review:
Play team fortress 2 it's better

Maybe i should explain OW1 was great i enjoyed it on release then this trash came out

ow2 feels more like a cash grab then a game

ow1 was fine the way it was we didn't need a crappy 2nd game that didn't deliver on what it was gonna give and literally was just ow1 with new heroes and a battle pass

for those saying in the discussion "stop review bombing this game" its not review bombing its genuine people who despise what blizzard has done

i played ow2 on release and it was bad

play tf2

stop malding cuz you dont like tf2

for those who get to see the end of this please try out tf2 first if you dont like tf2 feel free to come back to this

and for those saying "im just giving it a negative review cuz you prefer tf2 better"
yes i prefer tf2 better then ow2 but that doesn't mean i didn't like the first game because i did
as i said it feels more like a cash grab then an actual game.

- a person who has played ow1 ow2 and tf2

ã€‚

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.

I have a lot of hours invested in Overwatch since the good ol Overwatch 1 days where your only problem were the good ol lootboxes and at this point and time i can surely say that THIS... thing.... of a game is a huge shit show ever since it went F2P.

Don't get me wrong it was a shit show even before with the lack of content and the reused events so they could sell skins but now it's on a new kind of level. Also i would like to point that the lobbies you get qued in are so friendly that make League of Legends lobbies look like a harmful little puppy.

Yeah the game is a 10/10 if you like pain and suffering, would recommend! :D
since when my wallet is part of the gameplay mechnic?

While I have 3 hours logged on steam at time of writing, I have an additional 2100 hours logged on battle.net.  This is a great game, one that I will probably play until servers shut down.  This game will get a lot of hate, mainly for how badly blizzard has managed it in recent years as is evident by all the negative reviews, but I am yet to find another game that scratches that itch in the way Overwatch does.  I know many will disagree with me, probably call me a shill or something, but I personally think Overwatch deserves some recognition for how great a game is, I wouldn't have put thousands of hours into it if I didn't enjoy it after all.

I think this game still has potential to be a truly great game, while PVE was a disaster and broke the trust of many, I think given some time to grow it will eventually be seen as the great game that it is.

I recently had the misfortune of delving into the disappointing mess that is Overwatch 2. As a fan of the original Overwatch, I had hoped for a sequel that would elevate the franchise to new heights. Unfortunately, what I got was a convoluted, half-baked attempt at capitalizing on the success of its predecessor.

One of the most glaring issues with Overwatch 2 is the lack of innovation. It's as if the developers took the original game, slapped on a "2" at the end, and called it a day. The gameplay mechanics remain virtually unchanged, with the same stale objectives and repetitive matches. It's astonishing how little effort seems to have been put into evolving the gameplay for a sequel.

The new heroes introduced in Overwatch 2 are nothing short of underwhelming. Instead of offering fresh and exciting additions to the roster, we're presented with a handful of forgettable characters that lack the charm and uniqueness of their predecessors. It's almost as if the developers were scraping the bottom of the barrel for ideas, resulting in heroes that feel like pale imitations of the originals.

But perhaps the most baffling aspect of Overwatch 2 is the "story" mode. Supposedly a selling point of the sequel, the story mode feels like a tacked-on afterthought. The missions are monotonous and lack any real depth, with generic objectives and uninspired level design. It's evident that the developers wanted to cater to a single-player audience, but their execution falls flat on its face.

The visuals, while passable, fail to impress in the same way the original game did. Character models lack the same level of detail and polish, and the environments feel recycled and uninspired. It's clear that the developers were more focused on milking the franchise for all it's worth rather than delivering a visually stunning experience.

Overwatch 2's monetization strategy is also a slap in the face to its player base. With an array of microtransactions and loot boxes, the game feels more like a cash grab than a genuine attempt to provide enjoyable content. The focus on squeezing every last dollar out of players is evident, and it leaves a sour taste in the mouth of anyone who hoped for a more player-friendly approach.

In conclusion, Overwatch 2 is a disappointing sequel that fails to capture the magic of the original game. Its lack of innovation, forgettable characters, uninspired story mode, underwhelming visuals, and exploitative monetization make it a true low point in the franchise's history. Save your time and money and stick with the original Overwatch â€“ at least there, you'll find the enjoyment and excitement that Overwatch 2 sorely lacks.

FOR THE LOVE OF GOD 
STAY AWAY FROM THIS SHIT

I have over 2000 hours played on battle net, and am fairly good at the game (GM), I loved the game, and now playing it just annoys me, so my input matters more than the average reviewer here. 
My criticisms solely centres around the game and the gameplay, everyone already agrees the monetization is dogshit.

I stopped playing competitively 24/7 because they shattered the competitive queue by forcing a 2-2-2 role lock, it isn't a bad idea and is the eventual natural evolution of a competitive game of its genre, but the way they implemented it destroyed any semblance of fun dynamic gameplay and crushed the creativity from this fairly linear pvp shooter; because they were clueless at fixing the absolutely overpowered tank role, so they slapped a quick 2-2-2 as a 'fix' so abruptly as a panic reaction, which only made it not fun for dps players. The reduction to 5 player doesn't help either.

Tanks dominate this game, especially on higher ELO, tanks turn the tide, and tanks deal the damage, tanks soak the most healing, and tanks create space, everyone else is there to assist him win the game for you, this is because blizzard is incapable of balancing their game, the dps and healing role is downgrading into being the tank's bitch, cleaning up after them, or pumping them to make sure the enemy tanks die before yours does.
For the most part, you're only allowed to excel if your team's tank is performing better than the enemy's tank. When I want to win and feel in control of the game and feel like utilising skill to win rather rely on someone else, I have to play tank.
Blizzard's philosophy of balancing is to make everyone feel weak, while not necessarily uncommon in the genre, blizzard either consistently does it, or leaves it unchecked too long which ruins the fun of playing certain heroes.

The "Invasion" story mode is pathetic, you're playing a soulless version of Mann vs Machine, with no creativity, no effort, and just a few 'unique' units with buggy AI, all you do is shoot at slightly more clever training bots for 20 minutes and it's over. When I was confronted with an ana bot and an orisa bot as the final boss of a mission at the peak of the mission, I quit the game.

Also it's a joke how much you're forcing Overwatch to be the next big e-sports when the watchability is such garbage, you've cultivated a game where the ideal strategy is to scramble around and shoot pellets at each other until a healer fails or a tank/dps overextends and dies, spam shields and healing abilities which obscure 90% of the screen. I'm glad the OWL is crashing and burning, you deserve it for dedicating the budget into that instead of hiring competent people that understand game design and at making the game fun.
Blizzard Try not to harass Women Challenge (Impossible!! 99,9% FAIL!!!!)
